form.title: Variant Calling (nf-core/sarek)
form.description: Perform variant calling on unaligned sequence reads

workflow_version.title: Workflow Version
workflow_version.description: Select the specific version of nf-core/sarek used for analysis

analysis_type.title: Experiment Design
analysis_type.description: Indiciate the analysis type (germline/somatic) and select high level parameters for the workflow.

wes.title: Whole Exome/Targeted Gene Panel Assay
wes.description: Please indicate if your data was generated using a capture kit.

intervals.title: Genomic intervals
intervals.description: Target bed file in case of whole exome or targeted sequencing or intervals file for parallelization.

germline_resource.title: Germline resource
germline_resource.description: The germline resource VCF file (bgzipped) needed by GATK4 Mutect2 is a collection of calls that are likely present in the sample, with allele frequencies.

tools.title: Germline variant calling tool(s)
tools.description: Please select one or more variant callers for your analysis.

tools.title: Somatic variant calling tool(s)
tools.description: Please select one or more variant callers for your analysis.

joint_mutect2.title: Joint calling with Mutect2
joint_mutect2.description: Runs Mutect2 in joint (multi-sample) mode for better concordance among variant calls of tumor samples from the same patient.

annotation.title: Variant Annotation
annotation.description: Select variant annotation tools and VEP plugins.

annotation_tool.title: Annotation tool(s)
annotation_tool.description: Please select one or both variant annotation tools.

vep_dbnsfp.title: dbNSFP plugin
vep_dbnsfp.description: Enable the use of the VEP dbNSFP plugin that retrieves data for missense variants.

vep_loftee.title: LOFTEE plugin
vep_loftee.description: Enable the use of the VEP LOFTEE plugin to identify LoF (loss-of-function) variation.

vep_spliceai.title: SpliceAI plugin
vep_spliceai.description: Enable the use of the VEP SpliceAI plugin to annotate variants predicted effect on splicing.

vep_spliceregion.title: SpliceRegion plugin
vep_spliceregion.description: Enable the use of the VEP SpliceRegion plugin to provide granular predictions of splicing effects.

read_trimming_options.title: Read Trimming Options
read_trimming_options.description: Parameters for performing adapter and read trimming using Trim-Galore.

clip_r1.title: Clip R1
clip_r1.description: Instructs Trim Galore to remove bp from the 5' end of read 1 (or single-end reads).

clip_r2.title: Clip R2
clip_r2.description: Instructs Trim Galore to remove bp from the 5' end of read 2 (paired-end reads only).

three_prime_clip_r1.title: Three Prime Clip R1
three_prime_clip_r1.description: Instructs Trim Galore to remove bp from the 3' end of read 1 AFTER adapter/quality trimming has been performed.

three_prime_clip_r2.title: Three Prime Clip R2
three_prime_clip_r2.description: Instructs Trim Galore to remove bp from the 3' end of read 2 AFTER adapter/quality trimming has been performed.

trim_nextseq.title: Trim NextSeq
trim_nextseq.description: Instructs Trim Galore to apply the --nextseq=X option, to trim based on quality after removing poly-G tails.
trim_nextseq.help_text: This enables the option Cutadapt `--nextseq-trim=3'CUTOFF` option via Trim Galore, which will set a quality cutoff (that is normally given with -q instead), but qualities of G bases are ignored. This trimming is in common for the NextSeq- and NovaSeq-platforms, where basecalls without any signal are called as high-quality G bases.

save_trimmed.title: Save the trimmed FastQ files in the results directory?

optical_duplicate_pixel_distance.title: MarkDuplicates - Optical Duplicate Pixel Distance
optical_duplicate_pixel_distance.description: The `--OPTICAL_DUPLICATE_PIXEL_DISTANCE` parameter is used by MarkDuplicates to set the maximum offset between two duplicate clusters in pixels for them to be considered optical duplicates. A value of 100 is generally appropriate for unpatterned Illumina flowcells and 250 is appropriate for patterned Illumina flow cells.
